Machine Learning Intern, Vehicle PerceptionPalo Alto, CAInternship – AD/ADAS /Intern /HybridApply for this jobWoven by Toyota is enabling Toyota’s once-in-a-century transformation into a mobility company. Inspired by a legacy of innovating for the benefit of others, our mission is to challenge the current state of mobility through human-centric innovation — expanding what “mobility” means and how it serves society.Our work centers on four pillars: AD/ADAS, our autonomous driving and advanced driver assist technologies; Arene, our software development platform for software-defined vehicles; Woven City, a test course for mobility; and Cloud & AI, the digital infrastructure powering our collaborative foundation. Business-critical functions empower these teams to execute, and together, we’re working toward one bold goal: a world with zero accidents and enhanced well-being for all.TEAMAt Woven by Toyota, we work on a diverse set of problems ranging from solving optimization problems in 3D geometric computer vision, to minimizing latency on hardware accelerators, designing novel neural network architectures and applying and advancing the state-of-the-art of machine learning (ML) for perception, prediction, and motion planning. The Perception team is looking for a strong candidate in machine learning to join our 2025 intern program. During this time you will be working alongside our world class machine learning engineers to further push the boundaries of our state-of-the-art perception system for autonomous driving. Your future colleagues are experts in machine learning within the domain of autonomous driving and have developed and deployed numerous deep learning models throughout the entire software stack. This is an excellent opportunity for you to learn from them and make and have an impact on society. WHAT WE’LL GIVE YOUThe objective of this internship is for you to acquire hands-on industry experience and conduct research within the domain of autonomous driving. This will give you the opportunity to make use of our mature machine learning infrastructure as well as a massive amount of data for you to experiment with and ultimately to improve our system. The focus should be on research and ultimately deploying your work onto our prototype vehicles, which you will have the opportunity to experience on public roads. Woven by Toyota internships are structured to ensure you grow both technically and professionally. You will get a chance to work on real projects that affect future key results of our mission, while receiving constant feedback, with clear goals. You'll be supported by mentors and managers throughout your internship. At the end of the internship, you will share the results of your project with the team, and others that may be interested in your work.RESPONSIBILITIESPerception ML model R&D by prototyping, validating and iterating on existing and new model architectures.Own development of a new model functionality end-to-end. This means initial development, optimization, production platform validation, and fine tuning based on metrics and on road performance.Team player and “get things done” mentalityProduce a final report and present to the the autonomy teamCollaborate closely with other Perception team members as well as with upstream and downstream customer teams.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSCurrently pursuing a Masters or PhD degree with research focus in: Computer Vision, Robotics, Deep LearningStrong programming skills in Python and ML development with PyTorchProven ability to develop ML models Extensive experience in deep learningStrong communication skills and ability to communicate concepts clearly and preciselyPassionate about self driving car technology and its potential for humanityThe base pay for this position ranges from $30 - $55per hour.This internship is a temporary, non-permanent position designed to provide practical experience and learning opportunities. The duration of the internship is 12 weeks. The total compensation offered to an intern will be dependent upon the individual's skills, experience, qualifications, location, and level.Our Commitment・We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity.・Any information we receive from you will be used only in the hiring and onboarding process. Please see our privacy notice for more details.Apply for this job

Machine Learning Intern, AutolabelingPalo Alto, CAInternship – AD/ADAS /Intern /HybridApply for this jobWoven by Toyota is enabling Toyota’s once-in-a-century transformation into a mobility company. Inspired by a legacy of innovating for the benefit of others, our mission is to challenge the current state of mobility through human-centric innovation — expanding what “mobility” means and how it serves society.Our work centers on four pillars: AD/ADAS, our autonomous driving and advanced driver assist technologies; Arene, our software development platform for software-defined vehicles; Woven City, a test course for mobility; and Cloud & AI, the digital infrastructure powering our collaborative foundation. Business-critical functions empower these teams to execute, and together, we’re working toward one bold goal: a world with zero accidents and enhanced well-being for all.TEAMAre you ready to make a significant impact at the forefront of automotive technology? At the Autolabeling team at Woven by Toyota, we tackle a wide range of exciting challenges, from optimization and 3D geometric computer vision to pioneering advancements in machine learning (ML) for perception autolabeling. Our mission is to automatically generate vast quantities of high-quality, consistent, and diverse autolabeled data, driving the evolution of our data-driven solutions.WHO WE ARE LOOKING FORWe're on the lookout for a passionate and talented Machine Learning Intern who is eager to contribute to developing our innovative systems. As an intern, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate closely with one of our Senior ML Engineers, embarking on a future-focused project. Your role will involve integrating cutting-edge ML architectures and techniques into our Autolabeling stack development, pushing the boundaries of our technology and enhancing our autolabeling capabilities.This internship offers you the opportunity to work at the intersection of innovation and impact, where your contributions will play a crucial role in shaping the future of autonomous driving and intelligent systems. If you're driven by the desire to solve complex problems and leave a lasting mark on the industry, we invite you to join our team and become part of a group that's revolutionizing the way we see and interact with the world. Apply now and help us build the future of mobility!RESPONSIBILITIESConduct research to integrate state-of-the-art ML components into our auto-labeling pipeline, enhancing its efficiency and accuracy.Prepare and manage datasets to support data-driven model development and validation.Engage in daily collaboration with a ML Engineer, receiving mentorship and guidance while working on project tasks.Gain hands-on experience with production-level data and real-world applications, enhancing your practical skills in a professional setting.Summarize key findings and insights in a comprehensive final report, highlighting project outcomes and providing actionable recommendations.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSCurrently pursuing a Masters or a PhD degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Systems, Data Science, or similar disciplineProven ability to develop ML models for image, video, 3D or 4D data processing and/or generation (must be supported by school projects and/or publications)Strong programming skills in Python and ML development with PyTorchGood written and verbal communication skillsPassionate about self driving car technology and its potential for humanityNICE TO HAVES (optional)Experience developing ML models for autonomous driving or ADASExperience developing Perception algorithms for autonomous driving or ADASPublications in top tier CV, ML or robotics conferences or journalsThe base pay for this position ranges from $30 - $55 per hour.This internship is a temporary, non-permanent position designed to provide practical experience and learning opportunities. The duration of the internship is 12 weeks. The total compensation offered to an intern will be dependent upon the individual's skills, experience, qualifications, location, and level.Our Commitment・We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity.・Any information we receive from you will be used only in the hiring and onboarding process. Please see our privacy notice for more details.Apply for this job
